prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Summarized Context:
The witness Brushel describes how the victim died.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: A pianist who can't play a lick. Formerly an ace defense attorney of some renown.
Character 1
Name: Trucy Enigmar → Trucy Wright
Description: Future star magician, and Phoenix Wright's daughter. Fond of her Mr. Hat trick.
Character 2
Name: Vera Misham
Description: My client, apparently. I know nothing other than her name and mailing address.
Character 3
Name: Ema Skye
Description: Detective obsessed with forensics. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 4
Name: Drew Misham
Description: Painter known for his illustrations. Poisoned at Drew Studio.
Character 5
Name: Valant Gramarye
Description: Popular stage magician. His overly loquacious manner can get annoying.
Character 6
Name: Spark Brushel
Description: Freelance journalist. Can smell a scoop from miles away.
Character 7
Name: Klavier Gavin
Description: Star prosecutor and leader/vocalist for the rock group, the Gavinners.
Character 8
Name: Shadi Enigmar → Zak Gramarye
Description: My client in this case. Usually goes by his stage name, "Zak Gramarye".
Character 9
Name: Magnifi Gramarye
Description: The victim in this case. Died after being shot in the head while in the hospital.
Character 10
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 11
Name: Apollo Justice
Description: A greenhorn defense attorney I happened to meet. I call him Apollo.
Character 12
Name: Kristoph Gavin
Description: Incarcerated at the Central Penitentiary for the murder of Shadi Smith.
Character 13
Name: Thalassa Gramarye
Description: Trucy's mother. Still missing after her sudden disappearance.
Character 14
Name: Mike Meekins
Description: Bailiff responsible for security at the trial where Zak Gramarye vanished.
Character 15
Name: Shadi Smith
Description: In reality, the magician Zak. Murdered at Russian eatery: the Borscht Bowl Club.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: How long did I yearn for one of these? Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.* (when playing as Apollo Justice) It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.* (when playing as Phoenix Wright)
Evidence 1
Name: Magic Show Ticket
Description: For premier showing of a grand illusion, to be performed by the magician, Valant Gramarye.
Evidence 2
Name: Gramarye Envelope
Description: Envelope from Mr. Wright. Do not open until the time is right.
Evidence 3
Name: Vera's Card
Description: Defendant's business card. The address for Drew Studio is on the front.
Evidence 4
Name: Portrait
Description: Obtained at Drew Studio. That bit in the middle is supposed to be a person.
Evidence 5
Name: Acrylic
Description: Obtained at Drew Studio. An undersea scene in vivid colors.
Evidence 6
Name: Landscape
Description: Obtained at Drew Studio. Only half finished, the rough sketch is still visible.
Evidence 7
Name: Coffee Mug
Description: The victim's last mug of coffee. The scrawl on the side is Drew Misham's signature. Traces of the slow-acting deadly poison atroquinine were found on the rim.
Evidence 8
Name: Hidden Painting
Description: Found at Drew Studio. Notable for the large peach in the foreground.
Evidence 9
Name: Red Envelope
Description: Found in the victim's desk drawer. Appears to have been opened once and resealed. Found in the victim's desk drawer. Contains two sheets of writing paper.
Evidence 10
Name: Letter Box
Description: Drew Misham's contact with the outside world. It's empty.
Evidence 11
Name: Tiny Frame
Description: Frame measuring two inches by two inches. Bears traces of deadly poison atroquinine.
Evidence 12
Name: Brushel's Card
Description: This business card reads "Spark Brushel, Freelance Journalist".
Evidence 13
Name: Misham's Autopsy Report
Description: Death by atroquinine poisoning. Estimated time of death: 9:00-9:30 PM.
Evidence 14
Name: Crime Photo
Description: Body found in hospital room, shot in the forehead. Click here for details.
Evidence 15
Name: Magnifi's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: single gunshot to the head. Estimated time of death: 11:00-11:30 PM.
Evidence 16
Name: Notebook Page
Description: Mysterious paper received just before the trial. Click here for details. Forged to look like a page of Magnifi's diary. Click here for details.
Evidence 17
Name: Magnifi's Chart
Description: Diagnosed with a malignant tumor. Given 3 months. Click here for details.
Evidence 18
Name: Small Syringe
Description: Used for administering insulin shots. Has been washed and shows no sign of use.
Evidence 19
Name: Magnifi's Letter
Description: Letter asking Zak to shoot him. Click here for details.
Evidence 20
Name: Stage Pistol
Description: Fires one real bullet. Rifling marks match bullet found in victim. No fingerprints found.
Evidence 21
Name: Magnifi's Letter 2
Description: Letter telling Valant to come at 11:20 PM. Click here for details.
Evidence 22
Name: IV Report
Description: IV stopped 10 min. after administration began. Click here for details.
Evidence 23
Name: Magnifi's Diary
Description: A memoir of sorts. Written in up to just before he died.
Evidence 24
Name: The Amazing Mr. Hat
Description: Trucy's favorite trick. Startlingly realistic.
Evidence 25
Name: Trucy's Locket
Description: Contains a photo of Trucy's mother, Thalassa.
Evidence 26
Name: Transferal of Rights
Description: Document tranferring the right to perform the Gramarye repertoire to daughter Trucy.
Evidence 27
Name: Nail Polish
Description: Retrieved from Kristoph Gavin's cell. The nail polish is colorless.
Evidence 28
Name: Commemorative Stamp
Description: Commemorative stamp showing Troupe Gramarye. Click here for details. Sent from the real "client". Click here for details.
Evidence 29
Name: Thalassa's Portrait
Description: Photo of a young Thalassa, Trucy's mother. Click here for details.
Evidence 30
Name: Zak's Confession
Description: Confession to the slaying of Magnifi Gramarye. Click here for details.
Evidence 31
Name: Letter from Misham
Description: Letter posted by Drew Misham just before dying. Poison traces found on the stamp.
Evidence 32
Name: Letter from Mr. Wright
Description: Reproduction of information found by Mr. Wright during his investigation.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I visited the studio around 9:00 that night to do the interview.
Person: Brushel
Testimony 1
Testimony: The first outsider to enter the atelier! "Journalistic History Made", end quote!
Person: Brushel
Testimony 2
Testimony: His daughter brought us coffee right after we started.
Person: Brushel
Testimony 3
Testimony: And you know what happened next. "Star Falls!" end quote.
Person: Brushel
Testimony 4
Testimony: Those spasms... That was definitely death by poison.
Person: Brushel
Testimony 5
Testimony: I drank the coffee, too, but I'm not dead yet!
Person: Brushel
Testimony 6
Testimony: He had one sip, if that. The next moment, he was on the floor!
Person: Brushel
Testimony 7
Testimony: No one else entered the room besides her the whole time.
Person: Brushel

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies. Let me start by going through the testimonies first.

Looking at the testimonies by Brushel (Testimony 0 to 7). Testimony 0 says he visited the studio around 9:00 PM. Testimony 2 mentions that the daughter brought coffee right after they started. Testimony 6 states that Drew Misham had one sip and then collapsed. Testimony 5 says Brushel drank the coffee too but isn't dead. Testimony 4 claims the spasms were definitely poison. 

Now, looking at the evidence related to Drew Misham's death. Evidence 7 is the Coffee Mug with atroquinine poison on the rim. The autopsy report (Evidence 13) says time of death was 9:00-9:30 PM. 

Wait, Brushel's Testimony 6 says Drew had one sip and collapsed immediately. But the poison in the coffee is atroquinine, which is a slow-acting poison. If that's the case, then Drew shouldn't have died immediately after one sip. The contradiction here is between Testimony 6 (immediate death) and the nature of atroquinine being slow-acting as per Evidence 7. 

So the testimony that says he died immediately after a sip (Testimony 6) contradicts the evidence that the poison is slow-acting (Evidence 7). Therefore, the pair would be Evidence 7 and Testimony 6. Let me confirm again. Evidence 7's description mentions "slow-acting deadly poison atroquinine". So if Brushel says he collapsed right after drinking, but the poison is slow, that's a contradiction. Yep, that's the one.

{"evidence": 7, "testimony": 6}

response:
Okay, let's see. The user wants to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. They provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies. The task is to find a single pair where the evidence contradicts a testimony.

Looking at the testimonies from Brushel. Testimony 0 says when he arrived at the studio, Mr. Misham was at his desk. Testimony 1 says Misham was writing a letter and quickly sealed the envelope. Testimony 2 mentions it was a yellow envelope and that it was left at the crime scene. Testimony 3 is Brushel thinking nothing of it, and Testimony 4 speculates it's a suicide note.

Now, checking the evidences. Evidence 31 is the Letter from Misham, which was posted by Drew Misham just before dying. The description says poison traces were found on the stamp. But Brushel's Testimony 2 says the envelope he saw was yellow and left at the crime scene. However, Evidence 31 is a letter that was posted (mailed), not left at the scene. So if Misham mailed the letter, it wouldn't be at the crime scene. But Brushel claims the envelope he saw (yellow) was left at the crime scene. However, the actual letter from Misham (Evidence 31) was mailed, which contradicts Brushel's statement about it being left there. Alternatively, maybe Evidence 9 is the Red Envelope found in the victim's desk, which was opened and resealed. If the red envelope is in the desk, but Brushel saw a yellow one, that's a contradiction. Because Brushel says the envelope he saw was yellow and left at the crime scene, but the evidence (maybe the red envelope or the letter from Misham) is different. Wait, the Red Envelope (Evidence 9) is found in the victim's desk, but Brushel's testimony is about a yellow envelope. So if the envelope Brushel saw was yellow, but the one found in the desk is red, that's a contradiction. Also, Evidence 31 is a letter that was mailed, so it's not the same as the one left at the scene. Therefore, Testimony 2 (Brushel says the envelope was yellow and left at the crime scene) contradicts Evidence 9 (Red Envelope found in the desk), because the colors don't match and the location (left at scene vs in desk). So the contradiction is between Testimony 2 (yellow envelope left at scene) and Evidence 9 (red envelope found in desk). Alternatively, maybe Testimony 2 says the envelope was left at the crime scene, but if the actual evidence shows that the envelope was mailed (Evidence 31), then that's a contradiction. But Evidence 31's envelope would have been mailed, not left at the scene. However, Brushel's Testimony 2 says the envelope he saw (yellow) was left at the crime scene. But Evidence 31's letter was mailed, so it's not the same as the one Brushel saw. However, maybe the actual envelope found at the scene is a different one. Let me check the evidences again. Evidence 9 is a red envelope found in the victim's desk. So if Brushel saw a yellow envelope that was left at the scene, but the only envelope found in the desk is red, that's a contradiction. Therefore, Testimony 2 (yellow envelope left at scene) and Evidence 9 (red envelope in desk) contradict each other. Alternatively, maybe the red envelope was not left at the scene but in the desk. So the contradiction is that Brushel says the envelope he saw was left at the scene (yellow), but the evidence shows the red envelope was in the desk. Hence, the testimony and evidence don't align. Therefore, the correct pair would be Evidence 9 (Red Envelope) and Testimony 2 (yellow envelope left at scene). But let me confirm the testimony again. Testimony 2: "It was a yellow envelope. ...I heard it was left at the crime scene." So Brushel is saying that the envelope he saw Misham seal was a yellow one, which was left at the crime scene. But Evidence 9 is a red envelope found in the victim's desk. So that's a contradiction in color and location. Hence, the pair would be Evidence 9 and Testimony 2. But wait, Evidence 9 is the red envelope found in the desk, so if Brushel's testimony says the yellow one was left at the scene, but the actual evidence is a red one in the desk, that's a contradiction. Therefore, the answer should be {"evidence": 9, "testimony": 2}. Alternatively, maybe Evidence 31 is the one that was mailed, which is different. But the key contradiction is the color of the envelope. So the testimony says yellow, but the evidence is red. Hence, the pair is Evidence 9 and Testimony 2.

{"evidence": 9, "testimony": 2}
